title: Advanced WiFi Attack - Evil Twin and Traffic Interception
description: Advanced red team engagement demonstrating evil twin access point attack combined with traffic interception using bettercap. Shows how attackers can create fake WiFi networks to capture credentials and intercept traffic.
scenario: Red team engagement at conference venue to test attendee security awareness. Goal is to set up convincing evil twin access point mimicking venue WiFi, capture credentials from connecting devices, and demonstrate traffic interception capabilities. All activities authorized by venue management.

steps.action: Enable monitor mode for advanced WiFi reconnaissance and attack preparation
steps.expected_result: Monitor mode enabled on wlan0mon - ready for reconnaissance and rogue AP creation
steps.explanation: Monitor mode required for both recon and creating fake access point

steps.action: Scan WiFi environment to identify target network characteristics
steps.expected_result: Discovered 'ConferenceVenue-Guest' on channel 6, WPA2, BSSID AA:BB:CC:DD:EE:FF with 47 connected clients
steps.explanation: Understanding target network helps create convincing evil twin with similar characteristics

steps.action: Deauthenticate clients from legitimate AP to encourage evil twin connection
steps.expected_result: Mass deauth attack sent 320 frames - 47 clients disconnected from legitimate AP
steps.explanation: Deauth disrupts legitimate connections, forcing clients to search for network and potentially connect to evil twin

steps.action: Create evil twin access point with identical SSID
steps.expected_result: Rogue AP 'ConferenceVenue-Guest' started on channel 6 - appears identical to legitimate network
steps.explanation: Evil twin mimics legitimate network name, making it difficult for users to distinguish fake from real

steps.action: Capture WPA handshakes from clients connecting to evil twin
steps.expected_result: Captured 12 WPA handshakes in 3 minutes - 12 devices attempted connection to evil twin
steps.explanation: Handshakes captured can be cracked offline - demonstrates credential harvesting capability

steps.action: Enable MITM attack on connected clients to intercept HTTP traffic
steps.expected_result: MITM active - intercepted credentials from 5 clients accessing HTTP sites (non-HTTPS), captured 3 clear-text passwords
steps.explanation: Traffic interception demonstrates danger of connecting to untrusted networks and using unencrypted protocols

steps.action: Monitor client activity and connection patterns on evil twin
steps.expected_result: 12 clients connected to evil twin AP - captured 2.4 GB traffic including credentials, session cookies, unencrypted data
steps.explanation: Full traffic capture provides comprehensive view of client behavior on compromised network

steps.action: Crack captured handshakes to demonstrate credential recovery
steps.expected_result: 3 of 12 passwords cracked: 'Conference2024', 'Welcome123', 'guest@venue' - demonstrates weak password prevalence
steps.explanation: Post-attack analysis shows percentage of users with weak passwords vulnerable to dictionary attacks

steps.action: Disable rogue AP and restore normal operation
steps.expected_result: Rogue AP stopped, monitor mode disabled - attack infrastructure cleaned up
steps.explanation: Cleanup ensures attack infrastructure is properly shut down after assessment complete

outcome: Successfully demonstrated sophisticated WiFi attack chain combining evil twin AP, deauthentication, handshake capture, and traffic interception. Captured credentials from 12 devices, cracked 3 passwords, intercepted sensitive data from 5 clients. Findings revealed: 25% of users had weak passwords, 40% transmitted sensitive data over HTTP, 100% connected to fake network without verification. Recommendations: implement 802.1X enterprise authentication, mandatory VPN for sensitive work, security awareness training emphasizing risks of public WiFi, HTTPS-only policy for all applications.
learning_objectives: Create convincing evil twin access points
Combine multiple attack techniques (deauth + evil twin + MITM)
Capture and analyze WiFi handshakes from rogue AP
Intercept unencrypted traffic from compromised clients
Understand complete attack chain from reconnaissance to exploitation
Provide comprehensive remediation strategy for WiFi security
